data.title: Band of Brothers (2001)
data.summary: The story of Easy Company of the U.S. Army 101st Airborne Division, and their mission in World War II Europe, from Operation Overlord, through V-J Day.

data.title: The Vietnam War (2017)
data.summary: A comprehensive history of the United States' involvement in the bitterly divisive armed conflict in Southeast Asia.

data.title: The World at War (1973–1976)
data.summary: A groundbreaking 26-part documentary series narrated by the actor Laurence Olivier about the deadliest conflict in history, World War II.

data.title: The Civil War (1990)
data.summary: A comprehensive survey of the American Civil War.

data.title: The War (2007)
data.summary: A seven-part series focusing on the many ways in which the Second World War impacted the lives of American families.

data.title: Das Boot (1985–1986)
data.summary: A World War II German U-Boat crew have a terrifying patrol mission in the early days of the war.

data.title: Rome (2005–2007)
data.summary: A down-to-earth account of the lives of both illustrious and ordinary Romans set in the last days of the Roman Republic.

data.title: Blackadder Goes Forth (1989)
data.summary: Stuck in the middle of World War I, Captain Edmund Blackadder does his best to escape the banality of the war.

data.title: World War II in Colour (2009– )
data.summary: Recounts the events of world War II in color.

data.title: Vikings (2013– )
data.summary: The world of the Vikings is brought to life through the journey of Ragnar Lothbrok, the first Viking to emerge from Norse legend and onto the pages of history - a man on the edge of myth.

data.title: Generation Kill (2008)
data.summary: A Rolling Stone reporter, embedded with The 1st Recon Marines chronicles his experiences during the first wave of the American-led assault on Baghdad in 2003.

data.title: The Untold History of the United States (2012– )
data.summary: Oliver Stone's re-examination of under-reported events in American history.

data.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the 'Final Solution' (2005)
data.summary: The history of the Final Solution phase of the Nazi Holocaust, particularly with the most infamous of the death camps.

data.title: Unsere Mütter, unsere Väter (2013)
data.summary: Five friends go out to war and promise each other to be back for Christmas.

data.title: The Jewel in the Crown (1984)
data.summary: The British Raj: though their position seems secure, thoughtful English men and women know that "their" time in India is coming to an end. The story begins with an unjust arrest for rape, ...                See full summary »

data.title: Foyle's War (2002–2015)
data.summary: As WW2 rages around the world, DCS Foyle fights his own war on the home-front as he investigates crimes on the south coast of England. Later series sees the retired detective working as an MI5 agent operating in the aftermath of the war.

data.title: Roots (1977)
data.summary: A dramatization of author Alex Haley's family line from ancestor Kunta Kinte's enslavement to his descendants' liberation.

data.title: Tour of Duty (1987–1990)
data.summary: The trials of a U.S. Army platoon serving in the field during the Vietnam War.

data.title: Five Came Back (2017)
data.summary: The wartime contributions of five prominent Hollywood film directors during World War II are profiled.

data.title: Combat! (1962–1967)
data.summary: Combat!, a one-hour World War II drama series on television, followed a frontline American infantry squad as they battled their way across Europe. With mud-splattered realism, the show ...                See full summary »

data.title: M*A*S*H (1972–1983)
data.summary: The staff of an Army hospital in the Korean War find that laughter is the best way to deal with their situation.

data.title: The Pacific (2010)
data.summary: The Pacific Theatre of World War II, as seen through the eyes of several young Marines.

data.title: 'Allo 'Allo! (1982–1992)
data.summary: In France during World War II, Rene Artois runs a small café where Resistance fighters, Gestapo men, German Army officers and escaped Allied POWs interact daily, ignorant of one another's true identity or presence, exasperating Rene.

data.title: War and Remembrance (1988– )
data.summary: The trials of the Henry and the Jastrow families amidst the events after the U.S.'s entry into World War II.

data.title: Playhouse 90 (1956–1961)
data.summary: Of the many anthology series, Playhouse 90 is considered the most ambitious with outstanding talent in front of the camera. Attracting top ranked directors and scripts it was often filmed live including the entire first season.

data.title: The Promise (2011– )
data.summary: A young British girl travels to Israel/Palestine, retracing the steps of her grandfather - a British soldier stationed there in the 1940s.

data.title: War & Peace (2016)
data.summary: As the Russian conflict with Napoleon reaches its peak, five aristocratic families face the possibility of their lives being changed forever.

data.title: Jonathan Strange & Mr Norrell (2015)
data.summary: In an alternate history, during the time of real life Napoleonic Wars, two men of destiny, the gifted recluse Mr. Norrell and daring spellcasting novice Jonathan Strange, use magic to help England.

data.title: Home Fires (2015–2016)
data.summary: A drama following a group of inspirational women in a rural Cheshire community during World War II.

data.title: China Beach (1988–1991)
data.summary: The trials of a weary nurse, her friends and colleagues in a Vietnam War field hospital.

data.title: The Winds of War (1983– )
data.summary: The trials of the Henry and Jastrow families in the early years of World War II.

data.title: 12 O'Clock High (1964–1967)
data.summary: This series chronicled the adventures, in the air and on the ground, of the men of the 918th Bombardment Group of the U.S. Eighth Air Force. First commanded by irascible General Frank ...                See full summary »

data.title: Vatanim Sensin (2016–2018)
data.summary: Azize finds herself with her 3 children and mother-in-law in a difficult fight. She raises her children while fighting the difficulties of the war period and her husband's absence whom she ...                See full summary »

data.title: The Tudors (2007–2010)
data.summary: A dramatic series about the reign and marriages of King Henry VIII.

data.title: The Unit (2006–2009)
data.summary: Hour long show which looks at the life of American super-secret operators.

data.title: TURN (2014–2017)
data.summary: This drama follows Long Island farmer Abe Woodhull, who bands together a group of childhood friends to form The Culper Ring, an unlikely group of spies who turn the tide in America's fight ...                See full summary »

data.title: The Pillars of the Earth (2010)
data.summary: Set against a backdrop of war, religious strife and power struggles which tears lives and families apart.

data.title: North and South (1985–1994)
data.summary: Two friends, one northern and one southern, struggle to maintain their friendship as events build towards the American Civil War.

data.title: Dad's Army (1968–1977)
data.summary: A ragtag group of Home Guard volunteers prepare for an imminent German invasion during World War II.

data.title: Shogun (1980)
data.summary: A English navigator becomes both a player and pawn in the complex political games in feudal Japan.

data.title: Vikings: Athelstan's Journal (2015– )
data.summary: Viking culture is seen from a first-hand experience through Athelstan's perspective. Athelstan reflects his inner thoughts on the ways of the Northmen including all their customs, values, ...                See full summary »

data.title: Holocaust (1978– )
data.summary: The saga of a Jewish family's struggle to survive the horror of Nazi Germany's systematic marginalization and extermination of their community.

data.title: North and South, Book II (1986)
data.summary: The story of two friends and their families on opposite sides of the American Civil War.

data.title: Hatfields & McCoys (2012)
data.summary: Dramatization of the bitter blood feud between the two families on the West Virginia/Kentucky border in the years after the Civil War.

data.title: Kampen om tungtvannet (2015– )
data.summary: The story behind Hitler's plan of Germany getting the atomic bomb during WW2, and the heavy water sabotages in Rjukan, Norway, seen from four angles, the German side, the allied, the saboteurs and the company side.

data.title: Gallipoli (2015)
data.summary: Four young Australian boys join the military and are sent to Gallipoli.

data.title: Hogan's Heroes (1965–1971)
data.summary: The inmates of a German World War II prisoner of war camp conduct an espionage and sabotage campaign right under the noses of their warders.

data.title: Our Girl (2014– )
data.summary: The series follows Molly on her first deployment as a serving army medic against the backdrop of the British Army's withdrawal from Afghanistan. Series 2 introduces Georgie, her more experienced friend, as she is deployed to Eastern Africa.

data.title: Bomb Girls (2012– )
data.summary: A drama about World War II women at work in a munitions factory.

data.title: The Crimson Field (2014)
data.summary: During the First World War, Kitty Trevelyan tries to put the past troubles behind her as she joins two other girls to volunteer at one of the busy war hospitals in northern France.

data.title: Over There (2005)
data.summary: A dramatized take on war in Iraq.

data.title: The White Queen (2013)
data.summary: Three different, yet equally relentless women vie for the throne in 15th Century England.

data.title: Manhattan (2014–2015)
data.summary: In 1943, in Los Alamos, New Mexico, a team of government scientists is working on the top secret Manhattan Project in a race to produce an atomic bomb before the Nazis. Meanwhile, their families adjust to a life on the military base.

data.title: Shaka Zulu (1986– )
data.summary: A historical account on the life of the Zulu king Shaka.

data.title: The Book of Negroes (2015)
data.summary: Kidnapped in Africa and subsequently enslaved in South Carolina, Aminata must navigate a revolution in New York, isolation in Nova Scotia, and the treacherous jungles of Sierra Leone, in an attempt to secure her freedom in the eighteenth century.

data.title: Baa Baa Black Sheep (1976–1978)
data.summary: The dramatized World War II adventures of U.S. Major Gregory "Pappy" Boyington and his U.S. Marine Attack Squadron 214, (The Black Sheep Squadron).

data.title: Tiempos de guerra (2017– )
data.summary: In the Spanish city of Melilla, Morocco, during the Rif War of the 1920s, Spanish volunteer nurses with no experience adapt to their new lives.

data.title: Parade's End (2012)
data.summary: Revolves around a love triangle between a conservative English aristocrat, his mean socialite wife and a young suffragette.

data.title: Island at War (2004)
data.summary: During the Second World War, a quiet channel island community is thrown into turmoil by the invasion forces of Nazi Germany.

data.title: Ultimate Force (2002–2006)
data.summary: This action adventure series follows the exploits of Sergeant Henno Garvie and his colleagues who make up Red Troop, a crack SAS team. Stopping the release of a lethal anthrax mutation, ...                See full summary »

data.title: X Company (2015–2017)
data.summary: Set in the thrilling and dangerous world of WWII, follows the stories of five highly skilled young recruits, torn from their ordinary lives to train as agents in an ultra-secret facility.

data.title: The Bible (2013– )
data.summary: A religious historical dramatic miniseries about God's creation and physical landmark events leading up to the Crucifixion and Resurrection of our Savior, Jesus Christ.

data.title: The Rat Patrol (1966–1968)
data.summary: The World War II North African missions of an Allied commando patrol squad of the Long Range Desert Group.

data.title: House of Saddam (2008– )
data.summary: A mini-series that explores the inner workings of Saddam Hussein's family and his relationship with his closest advisers.

data.title: The Last Ship (2014– )
data.summary: The crew of a naval destroyer is forced to confront the reality of a new existence when a pandemic kills off most of the earth's population.

data.title: The Brave (2017–2018)
data.summary: The complex world of our bravest military heroes who make personal sacrifices while executing the most challenging and dangerous missions behind enemy lines.

data.title: McHale's Navy (1962–1966)
data.summary: The misadventures of a misfit PT boat crew during World War II.

data.title: The Long Road Home (2017– )
data.summary: American forces occupying Iraq are ambushed in a Baghdad neighborhood.

data.title: My Mother and Other Strangers (2016– )
data.summary: In 1943, the Coyne family and their neighbours struggle to maintain a normal life after a US Army Air Force base is set up in the middle of their rural parish.

data.title: The Diary of Anne Frank (2009)
data.summary: During World War II, a teenage Jewish girl named Anne Frank and her family are forced into hiding in the Nazi-occupied Netherlands.

data.title: The Halcyon (2017– )
data.summary: The story of a bustling and glamorous five star hotel at the center of London society and a world at war.

data.title: Birdsong (2012)
data.summary: As an English soldier fights in the horrific trenches of northern France, he is haunted by the memories of his forbidden love affair with a French woman.

data.title: Napoléon (2002)
data.summary: The year is 1816, and Napoleon, held prisoner by the British on the island of St. Helena, is telling the young English girl Betsy his life story. His meteoric rise to military prominence ...                See full summary »

data.title: Six (2017–2018)
data.summary: Navy SEAL Team Six attempt to eliminate a Taliban leader in Afghanistan when they discover an American citizen working with the enemy.

data.title: Hitler: The Rise of Evil (2003)
data.summary: A unique slant, profiling the life of Adolf Hitler as a child and his rise through the ranks of the National Socialist German Workers' Party prior to World War II.

data.title: Dirilis: Ertugrul (2014– )
data.summary: The heroic story of Ertugrul Ghazi, the father of Osman (Uthman) who founded the Ottoman Caliphate.

data.title: Army Wives (2007–2013)
data.summary: Four women and one man share the common bond of loving someone in the U.S. Army.

data.title: The Devil's Whore (2008)
data.summary: Set between the years 1642 and 1660, "The Devil's Whore" charts the progress of the English Civil War through the eyes of a 17 year old girl, the fictional Angelica Fanshawe.

data.title: Gomer Pyle: USMC (1964–1969)
data.summary: The misadventures of a bumbling U.S. Marine named Gomer Pyle.

data.title: The Last Post (2017)
data.summary: Aden 1965. This is the story of a British army unit fighting a Yemeni insurgency in the Middle East and the women and children who were there with them.

data.title: Rebellion (2016)
data.summary: Rebellion is a five part serial drama about the birth of modern Ireland. The story is told from the perspectives of a group of fictional characters who live through the political events of the 1916 Easter Rising.

data.title: Söz (2017– )
data.summary: Yavuz Karasu, a well-trained Turkish soldier, is in Istanbul with his fiance where a terrorist operation takes place. Dr. Bahar, who is not a surgeon, tries to save his fiance. After this ...                See full summary »

data.title: It Ain't Half Hot Mum (1974–1981)
data.summary: The comic adventures of a group of misfits who form an extremely bad concert party touring the hot and steamy jungles of Burma entertaining the troops during World War II.

data.title: SEAL Team (2017– )
data.summary: The lives of the elite Navy S.E.A.L.s as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions our country can ask.

data.title: Anne of Green Gables: The Continuing Story (2000– )
data.summary: The continuing adventures of Anne Shirley in New York and in France during World War I.

data.title: Attila (2001)
data.summary: A romanced story of Attila the Hun, from when he lost his parents in childhood until his death. Attila is disclosed as a great leader, strategist and lover and the movie shows his respect ...                See full summary »

data.title: Kurt Seyit ve Sura (2014)
data.summary: The love story of Kurt Seyit, an army major, and Sura, a Russian woman.

data.title: Gharabeeb Soud (2017)
data.summary: A look at the lives of various members of an ISIS terrorist cell.

data.title: Muhtesem Yüzyil (2011–2014)
data.summary: From 1520, follows Suleiman the Magnificent and his relatives from his great conquests to the "Battle of Szigeth".
When Prussia and Austria declare war on Denmark, two brothers are called to serve in the bloodiest battle in Denmark's history.

data.title: New Worlds (2014)
data.summary: The 1680s bring a new king, Restoration and more tyranny. In Massachusetts, a robber's son falls for an anti-monarchist. In England, young lady falls for an outlaw.

data.title: Tomorrow, When the War Began (2016– )
data.summary: A group of teenagers return from a camping trip to find themselves in the middle of an unexpected war. Among only a few Australians still free, they must learn to defend themselves against the hostile invaders.

data.title: Troy: Fall of a City (2018– )
data.summary: Retells the story of the 10 year siege of Troy, which occurred in the 12 or 13th century BC.

data.title: Catch-22 (2019– )
data.summary: Limited series adaptation of the classic Joseph Heller novel.

data.title: Das Boot (2018– )
data.summary: A sequel to Das Boot (1981).

data.title: Medal of Honor (2019– )
data.summary: A hybrid docu/live-action anthology series that portrays stories of personal sacrifice that resulted in the highest military distinction: the Medal of Honor.
